intro: Gymnosporia forsskaoliana, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves that are adapted to conserve water. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by woody, fleshy fruits containing seeds. It is a member of the family Capparaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Gymnosporia forsskaoliana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
